channel.title: List on Chase Kanipe
channel.description: Recent content in List on Chase Kanipe

item.title: Favorite Papers
item.description: Here’s a list of my favorite papers. Computer Science Exposing the Perils of Security Oblivious Energy Management Philosophy Todo Neuroscience Could a Neuroscientist Understand a Microprocessor? Funny What’s the Deal with Birds? A Demonstration of the Causal Power of Absences Sokal Hoax Long-Term Study of HRV Responses to Changes in the Solar and Geomagnetic Environment

item.title: Favorite Words
item.description: Here’s a reference list of words I like to include in essays. Ameliorate, ascendant, ascertain, assertion, assessment, constituents, constitute, counterfactual, dispositive, eschaton, ephemeral, equilibrate, equivocate, exemplar, extemporaneous, harrowing, ideation, imperative, litany, litigate, obfuscate, obscure, opaque, parsimonious, recount, subvert, systematic, vexatious, voluminous

item.title: Favorite Videos
item.description: Computer Science Jim Keller on Microprocessors: An interview that discusses Jim's career history, moore's law, his hiring philosophy, and more. Jim Keller on the future of computing: An interview that discusses Jim's perspectives on the future of computing, AI, life, consciousness, and more. GPT-4, ChatGPT, and the Future of AI: An interview with Sam Altman on OpenAI, GPT4, ChatGPT, DALL-E and many other leading AI technologies. AI Safety: A discussion with Scott Aaronson on his work with OpenAI on ChatGPT, AI saftey, AI alignment, and various other topics.

item.title: Favorite Books
item.description: Here’s a list of some of my favorite non-fiction books. I’ll continue to update this list as I discover new favories. Computer Science The C Programming Language The C++ Programming Language The Rust Programming Language Build Your Own Programming Language Learn LLVM 12 Crafting Interpreters Introduction to Static Analysis Windows Kernel Programming Modern x86 Assembly Language Learn You a Haskell for Great Good Cybersecurity Reversing: Secrets of Reverse Engineering Hacking: The Art of Exploitation

item.title: Favorite Quotes
item.description: The line between good and evil runs down the heart of every man You will die but C will live - Unknown professor
